column1: Hypospadias repair is surgery to correct a defect in the opening of the penis that is present at birth.
Boys who are born with hypospadias should not be circumcised at birth.
Before surgery, your child will receive general anesthesia.
Hypospadias is one of the most common birth defects in boys.
This surgery is performed on most boys who are born with the problem.
Risks for this procedure include: - A hole that leaks urine (fistula) - Large blood clot (hematoma) - Scarring or narrowing of the repaired urethra
- The doctor will make sure your child is healthy enough for surgery.
